column19: Plenty to consider but STOLEN KISS is firmly on the up and he can successfully graduate to Pattern company.

column36: Rested since poor reappearance in March but would have leading claims if back to his best
column37: Clear career best when waltzing off with a Curragh Group 2 last July, form that gives him strong claims here; creditable effort when fifth of 16 in the Group 1 Foret in October but he was a bitter disappointment on reappearance when last of nine in a Curragh Listed race (7f, good) in March; rested since.

column4: Betwright Bet The Wright Way Apprentice Handicap
column19: Zambezi Magic won easily on Tuesday but is opposed with BRAMBLE JELLY, who scored over C&D on heavy ground last autumn.
column20: 15/8 Zambezi Magic, 4/1 Bramble Jelly, 7/1 Bobby Dassler, 10/1 Blue Hero,  Stormy Lady, 12/1 Alioski,  My Brother Mike,  Daany,  Spinning Dancer, 25/1 Positivia, 33/1 The Dark Baron, 100/1 Tilsworth Silver
column36: Well beaten after racing too freely on both stable starts; has a lot to prove
column37: Seven-race maiden (including two bumpers) who was well beaten after racing too freely on first two starts for new stable (1m2f/1m4f); eased in grade today and should handle the ground but still has a lot to prove.

column4: Betwright Bet The Wright Way Apprentice Handicap
column19: Zambezi Magic won easily on Tuesday but is opposed with BRAMBLE JELLY, who scored over C&D on heavy ground last autumn.
column20: 15/8 Zambezi Magic, 4/1 Bramble Jelly, 7/1 Bobby Dassler, 10/1 Blue Hero,  Stormy Lady, 12/1 Alioski,  My Brother Mike,  Daany,  Spinning Dancer, 25/1 Positivia, 33/1 The Dark Baron, 100/1 Tilsworth Silver
column36: Coped far better than the others with heavy ground at Ffos Las on Tuesday; has 4lb penalty
column37: No longer the force of old but coped far better than the others with the heavy ground at Ffos Las (1m2f) on Tuesday, cantering clear to win easily by over 9l; commands respect under 4lb penalty here.

column4: Betwright Bet The Wright Way Apprentice Handicap
column19: Zambezi Magic won easily on Tuesday but is opposed with BRAMBLE JELLY, who scored over C&D on heavy ground last autumn.
column20: 15/8 Zambezi Magic, 4/1 Bramble Jelly, 7/1 Bobby Dassler, 10/1 Blue Hero,  Stormy Lady, 12/1 Alioski,  My Brother Mike,  Daany,  Spinning Dancer, 25/1 Positivia, 33/1 The Dark Baron, 100/1 Tilsworth Silver
column27: Saleh Al Homaizi & Imad Al Sagar
column36: Absent since substandard AW run in April but has 2-2 record on heavy ground
column37: Absent since safely held on Tapeta in April but his penultimate AW run was a good effort and his 2-2 record on heavy ground brings him into each-way calculations.

column4: Betwright Bet The Wright Way Apprentice Handicap
column19: Zambezi Magic won easily on Tuesday but is opposed with BRAMBLE JELLY, who scored over C&D on heavy ground last autumn.
column20: 15/8 Zambezi Magic, 4/1 Bramble Jelly, 7/1 Bobby Dassler, 10/1 Blue Hero,  Stormy Lady, 12/1 Alioski,  My Brother Mike,  Daany,  Spinning Dancer, 25/1 Positivia, 33/1 The Dark Baron, 100/1 Tilsworth Silver
column36: Nine-time course winner; current mark is workable but he'd appeal more on better ground
column37: Nine-time course winner, on ground ranging from firm to good to soft; still on workable mark after 3lb rise for last month's C&D success and encountered traffic when only ninth on heavy ground here 11 days ago but, nevertheless, he'd appeal much more on a quicker surface.

column4: Betwright Bet The Wright Way Apprentice Handicap
column19: Zambezi Magic won easily on Tuesday but is opposed with BRAMBLE JELLY, who scored over C&D on heavy ground last autumn.
column20: 15/8 Zambezi Magic, 4/1 Bramble Jelly, 7/1 Bobby Dassler, 10/1 Blue Hero,  Stormy Lady, 12/1 Alioski,  My Brother Mike,  Daany,  Spinning Dancer, 25/1 Positivia, 33/1 The Dark Baron, 100/1 Tilsworth Silver
column36: Veteran who is much more prolific on AW; effective on soft turf but others appeal more
column37: Much more prolific on AW but has a soft-ground C&D win on his CV; did not enjoy run of the race when sixth in 1m Chepstow classified in July, after a break, but still needs to build on that performance here.

column4: Betwright Bet The Wright Way Apprentice Handicap
column19: Zambezi Magic won easily on Tuesday but is opposed with BRAMBLE JELLY, who scored over C&D on heavy ground last autumn.
column20: 15/8 Zambezi Magic, 4/1 Bramble Jelly, 7/1 Bobby Dassler, 10/1 Blue Hero,  Stormy Lady, 12/1 Alioski,  My Brother Mike,  Daany,  Spinning Dancer, 25/1 Positivia, 33/1 The Dark Baron, 100/1 Tilsworth Silver
column36: Consistent at Ffos Las since returned to turf this summer; engaged 7.15 here last night
column37: Returned to turf with four pretty good efforts at Ffos Las (1m-1m2f) this summer, the last three for current stable, and seems quite versatile regarding ground; due to run in 7.15 here last night; will warrant consideration if he contests this race.

column4: Betwright Bet The Wright Way Apprentice Handicap
column19: Zambezi Magic won easily on Tuesday but is opposed with BRAMBLE JELLY, who scored over C&D on heavy ground last autumn.
column20: 15/8 Zambezi Magic, 4/1 Bramble Jelly, 7/1 Bobby Dassler, 10/1 Blue Hero,  Stormy Lady, 12/1 Alioski,  My Brother Mike,  Daany,  Spinning Dancer, 25/1 Positivia, 33/1 The Dark Baron, 100/1 Tilsworth Silver
column36: Back in form last month and was a heavy-ground C&D winner last autumn; high on the list
column37: Returned from break with two below-par runs in July but last month's Ffos Las second (1m4f, soft) was much better, and she was a heavy-ground C&D winner off today's mark last autumn; high on the list.

column4: Betwright Bet The Wright Way Apprentice Handicap
column19: Zambezi Magic won easily on Tuesday but is opposed with BRAMBLE JELLY, who scored over C&D on heavy ground last autumn.
column20: 15/8 Zambezi Magic, 4/1 Bramble Jelly, 7/1 Bobby Dassler, 10/1 Blue Hero,  Stormy Lady, 12/1 Alioski,  My Brother Mike,  Daany,  Spinning Dancer, 25/1 Positivia, 33/1 The Dark Baron, 100/1 Tilsworth Silver
column32: Duckhaven D Kenealy W Sprigg M Sprigg
column36: Returned from layoff with quiet run last month but has no ground worries here
column37: Won four times over hurdles (once on heavy ground) and once on the Flat during productive 2024; returned from layoff with a quiet run last month but has possibilities here if that outing brought him on.

column4: Betwright Bet The Wright Way Apprentice Handicap
column19: Zambezi Magic won easily on Tuesday but is opposed with BRAMBLE JELLY, who scored over C&D on heavy ground last autumn.
column20: 15/8 Zambezi Magic, 4/1 Bramble Jelly, 7/1 Bobby Dassler, 10/1 Blue Hero,  Stormy Lady, 12/1 Alioski,  My Brother Mike,  Daany,  Spinning Dancer, 25/1 Positivia, 33/1 The Dark Baron, 100/1 Tilsworth Silver
column36: Unplaced all 11 starts and has puny BHA rating of 34
column37: Unplaced all 11 starts and has puny BHA rating of 34; needs this first run on turf slower than good to soft to unveil huge improvement.

column4: Betwright Bet The Wright Way Apprentice Handicap
column19: Zambezi Magic won easily on Tuesday but is opposed with BRAMBLE JELLY, who scored over C&D on heavy ground last autumn.
column20: 15/8 Zambezi Magic, 4/1 Bramble Jelly, 7/1 Bobby Dassler, 10/1 Blue Hero,  Stormy Lady, 12/1 Alioski,  My Brother Mike,  Daany,  Spinning Dancer, 25/1 Positivia, 33/1 The Dark Baron, 100/1 Tilsworth Silver
column36: Not disgraced on stable/hurdle debut but subsequently well beaten on Flat return
column37: Disappointing maiden on the Flat in Ireland (seven starts); not disgraced on stable/hurdle debut in July but beaten 17l on the Flat since (albeit over 1m6f in better race than this) and difficult to enthuse over.

column4: Betwright Bet The Wright Way Apprentice Handicap
column19: Zambezi Magic won easily on Tuesday but is opposed with BRAMBLE JELLY, who scored over C&D on heavy ground last autumn.
column20: 15/8 Zambezi Magic, 4/1 Bramble Jelly, 7/1 Bobby Dassler, 10/1 Blue Hero,  Stormy Lady, 12/1 Alioski,  My Brother Mike,  Daany,  Spinning Dancer, 25/1 Positivia, 33/1 The Dark Baron, 100/1 Tilsworth Silver
column36: Placed in AW classified when upped to 1m2f month; claims if heavy ground suits her
column37: Unexposed after only six runs and looked suited by step up to 1m2f when placed in AW classified race last month; could have a say if suited by the forecast heavy ground here (unraced on turf slower than good).

column4: Betwright Bet The Wright Way Apprentice Handicap
column19: Zambezi Magic won easily on Tuesday but is opposed with BRAMBLE JELLY, who scored over C&D on heavy ground last autumn.
column20: 15/8 Zambezi Magic, 4/1 Bramble Jelly, 7/1 Bobby Dassler, 10/1 Blue Hero,  Stormy Lady, 12/1 Alioski,  My Brother Mike,  Daany,  Spinning Dancer, 25/1 Positivia, 33/1 The Dark Baron, 100/1 Tilsworth Silver
column36: Placed at 50-1 on AW last week; tried new trip-and-ground combination here
column37: Placed for first time in 12-race career when 50-1 second at Wolverhampton (8.6f, AW) last week but it's hard to predict whether this new trip-and-ground combination will be her cup of tea.

column4: Betwright Bangers N'Cash Nursery Handicap
column19: David Loughnane's REJJIEN has made a solid start to her handicap career, and her proven ability on soft ground is a big selling point.
column20: 2/1 Rejjien, 11/4 Karakula Dancer, 7/2 Lady Lauren, 13/2 Isthatu, 10/1 Takeitorleaveit, 16/1 Amalfi Bluebell,  Lynxman
column36: Shaped quite well on debut (7f) but soundly beaten twice since
column37: Shaped quite well before fading into seventh on debut at Leicester (7f, good to firm) in June but soundly beaten twice since and subsequently gelded; wears first-time cheekpieces, moves up in trip and encounters much slower ground on this nursery debut.

column4: Betwright Bangers N'Cash Nursery Handicap
column19: David Loughnane's REJJIEN has made a solid start to her handicap career, and her proven ability on soft ground is a big selling point.
column20: 2/1 Rejjien, 11/4 Karakula Dancer, 7/2 Lady Lauren, 13/2 Isthatu, 10/1 Takeitorleaveit, 16/1 Amalfi Bluebell,  Lynxman
column36: Showed first glimmer of promise in her final qualifying run; up in trip for nursery debut
column37: Struggled on first two outings (6f/7f) but last month's seventh of nine in a good Lingfield maiden (7f, good) was more encouraging, and further progress is possible if she handles the slower ground on nursery debut.

column4: Betwright Bangers N'Cash Nursery Handicap
column19: David Loughnane's REJJIEN has made a solid start to her handicap career, and her proven ability on soft ground is a big selling point.
column20: 2/1 Rejjien, 11/4 Karakula Dancer, 7/2 Lady Lauren, 13/2 Isthatu, 10/1 Takeitorleaveit, 16/1 Amalfi Bluebell,  Lynxman
column36: Only fourth of six when favourite for nursery debut but may yet do better
column37: Unable to justify favouritism when only fourth of six on nursery debut at Lingfield (7f, AW; first-time cheekpieces) last month but could still have a bigger run in him if this very different test suits.

column37: Very hard to knock since joining Sam England in the spring, including with three 1m4f wins; often contested amateurs' races of late, catching the eye when finishing close up at Catterick (his effort was left too late) and Haydock (failing to get run of the race) on last two outings; they were also over a bit further than this, however.

column36: 3yo whose last four races have yielded two wins and two seconds; needs plenty of respect
column37: 3yo whose last four races have yielded two wins and two seconds, all when held up and he seems effective at 1m2f and 1m4f; the first two of those races were on turf (good to soft/good) and the last two on AW, winning by a head with strong finish in a Racing League race at Southwell last time; raised another 5lb but needs plenty of respect.

column37: Won 7f AW maiden last October for Charlie Hills but beat only two rivals this season across his first four handicaps; going beyond 1m for first time needs to turn things around dramatically but his dam was a 1m5f winner.

column37: 0-4 for Jessica Harrington; third of six at Haydock (10.5f, good) in June on stable debut was creditable but heavy defeats on both starts since.

column37: Won two minor events in May (7f; good to firm/good) and found some trouble in running when 13-2 for a big-field handicap at Glorious Goodwood (good to soft); easy to give him another chance off this mark.

column37: Strike-rate of 3-8, with one of those wins on good to soft; endured a wide trip when placed at Chester last time but was beaten 4l and whether he wants 7f remains to be seen (confined to sprinting thus far).

column37: Finished in close proximity to smart horses as a 2yo and made a successful reappearance (having been gelded) at Newmarket in June (7f, good to firm; 4lb lower); finished last at Ascot two months ago (1m) but got upset in the preliminaries and raced freely; wouldn't be exposed just yet; has won on good to soft but disappointed on soft.

column37: Debut winner last year and has gradually found his form this campaign, doubling his tally when trying 7f for the first time at Newbury (good; unraced on slower); that was no more than workmanlike and he's 4lb higher in a deeper race.

column36: Placed form in novice events doesn't look good enough; ground concerns too
column37: Mohaather filly cost 28,000euros as a yearling; half-sister to winners Danville (1m-1m2f; RPR 92), Mashaheer (1m; 86) and Conquering (German 12.5f); dam placed 1m4f, half-sister to US 1m/1m1f Grade 2 winner Uncharted Haven; placed in novice events at Newbury and Windsor on quick ground, well below best in between on heavy; respected source but looks to have a fair bit to find and possible ground concerns.

column4: Moyglare Stud Stakes (Group 1) (Fillies)
column19: The unbeaten Venetian Sun may not have the stamina to resist COMPOSING whose liking for this trip is already established
column20: 5/4 Composing, 13/8 Venetian Sun, 6/1 Beautify, 10/1 Suzie Songs, 12/1 Precise, 33/1 Pivotal Attack,  Skydance
column32: Derrick Smith & Mrs John Magnier & Michael Tabor
column36: Beat the Molecomb winner Lady Iman over 6f here in July, smart prospect, should stay 7f
column37: Pleasing third on debut over 6f at this venue; winner Balantina twice placed at Group 3 level since then, including third in the Albany; built on her initial experience when defeating the odds-on Lady Iman and today's rival Skydance in a 6f Group 3 here in July; runner-up franked the form in the Molecomb; should have no trouble with 7f, but Composing appears stronger.

column4: Moyglare Stud Stakes (Group 1) (Fillies)
column19: The unbeaten Venetian Sun may not have the stamina to resist COMPOSING whose liking for this trip is already established
column20: 5/4 Composing, 13/8 Venetian Sun, 6/1 Beautify, 10/1 Suzie Songs, 12/1 Precise, 33/1 Pivotal Attack,  Skydance
column36: Already a Pattern winner at 7f, may stay more effectively than the unbeaten Venetian Sun
column37: Only fifth on debut in race in which longer-priced stablemate Beautify was third; unbeaten in three races since then, a C&D maiden and small-field Group 3 races at Leopardstown (beat Skydance readily) and C&D, taking the measure of the front-running Suzie Songs; may stay more effectively than the unbeaten Venetian Sun; dam handled soft ground well.

column4: Moyglare Stud Stakes (Group 1) (Fillies)
column19: The unbeaten Venetian Sun may not have the stamina to resist COMPOSING whose liking for this trip is already established
column20: 5/4 Composing, 13/8 Venetian Sun, 6/1 Beautify, 10/1 Suzie Songs, 12/1 Precise, 33/1 Pivotal Attack,  Skydance
column36: Looked useful when winning at Galway, hard to see her being good enough in this grade
column37: Finished well over 6f on Fairyhouse debut; appreciated the step up to 7f when beating Aidan O'Brien-trained favourite and subsequent Cork winner Black Caviar Gold on yielding ground at Galway; takes a massive jump in class.

column4: Moyglare Stud Stakes (Group 1) (Fillies)
column19: The unbeaten Venetian Sun may not have the stamina to resist COMPOSING whose liking for this trip is already established
column20: 5/4 Composing, 13/8 Venetian Sun, 6/1 Beautify, 10/1 Suzie Songs, 12/1 Precise, 33/1 Pivotal Attack,  Skydance
column36: Group 3 winner at Goodwood, looks like the outsider for three for Ballydoyle
column37: Finished in front of Pivotal Attack when second over 6f on debut at Fairyhouse; easy winner when stepped up to 7f at Cork; backed that up with a Group 3 win at Goodwood, form due to be put to the test by fourth-placed Sukanya in the 2.15 at Leopardstown on Saturday.

column4: Moyglare Stud Stakes (Group 1) (Fillies)
column19: The unbeaten Venetian Sun may not have the stamina to resist COMPOSING whose liking for this trip is already established

column36: Last of six when Composing dominated Suzie Songs in a Group 2 over C&D last month
column37: Ran well when third to Beautify in a 6f Group 2 here in June; comfortably beaten by both Suzie Songs and Composing either side of that; a struggling last of six when Composing dominated Suzie Songs in a Group 2 over C&D last month.

column4: Moyglare Stud Stakes (Group 1) (Fillies)
column19: The unbeaten Venetian Sun may not have the stamina to resist COMPOSING whose liking for this trip is already established
column20: 5/4 Composing, 13/8 Venetian Sun, 6/1 Beautify, 10/1 Suzie Songs, 12/1 Precise, 33/1 Pivotal Attack,  Skydance
column36: 2-2 before failing to cope with Composing when trying this trip for the first time, hooded
column37: Beat the useful Havana Anna on debut at Cork and caused a surprise when getting the better of hot favourite Flushing Meadows in the Anglesey Stakes; raced a bit too keenly and failed to cope with Composing when trying this trip for the first time in Debutante Stakes; hooded now.

column4: Moyglare Stud Stakes (Group 1) (Fillies)

column20: 5/4 Composing, 13/8 Venetian Sun, 6/1 Beautify, 10/1 Suzie Songs, 12/1 Precise, 33/1 Pivotal Attack,  Skydance
column36: Unbeaten in four races, already a Group 1 winner against the colts, 7f could stretch her
column37: A revelation since a debut success at Carlisle, climbing the Pattern level at a rapid rate; landed the Group 3 Albany Stakes and the Group 2 Duchess Of Cambridge Stakes (beating the subsequent Lowther winner Royal Fixation); gamely resisted the Coventry winner Gstaad in the Prix Morny; tough and talented, hard to be sure she will stay 7f at this stage.

column36: Boasts a fine record at this track, should be sharper for last month's seasonal debut here
column37: Winner of four of his seven starts at this venue; went through last season without adding to a career tally of nine wins; career highlight, a Group 1 Ascot success in October 2023; faded late into fourth behind Bucanero Fuerte when making a belated start to the season over 6f here last month.

column4: Bar One Racing Flying Five Stakes (Group 1)
column19: Winner of four of his seven races at this venue, ART POWER is tipped in the hope he can hit top form on his second start of the season
column20: 7/2 Asfoora, 5/1 Bucanero Fuerte, 6/1 Arizona Blaze, 8/1 Night Raider, 10/1 Art Power,  Whistlejacket,  Mgheera,  She's Quality, 12/1 Two Stars, 16/1 Nighteyes, 20/1 Powerful Nation, 33/1 Erosandpsyche,  Grande Marques, 50/1 Lady With The Lamp,  Saratoga Special, 66/1 Vadream
column32: AMO Racing Limited & Giselle De Aguiar
column36: 2023 Phoenix Stakes winner, back in excellent shape, 2-2 this season, strong contender
column37: 2023 Phoenix Stakes winner; disappointing last autumn (including when seventh in this race) after a Group 3 win at Naas in the spring; after a brief spell at stud, made a reassuring start to the campaign with a 5f Naas win over Powerful Nation in May; followed up with a 6f Group 2 win here last month; big player.

column4: Bar One Racing Flying Five Stakes (Group 1)
column19: Winner of four of his seven races at this venue, ART POWER is tipped in the hope he can hit top form on his second start of the season
column20: 7/2 Asfoora, 5/1 Bucanero Fuerte, 6/1 Arizona Blaze, 8/1 Night Raider, 10/1 Art Power,  Whistlejacket,  Mgheera,  She's Quality, 12/1 Two Stars, 16/1 Nighteyes, 20/1 Powerful Nation, 33/1 Erosandpsyche,  Grande Marques, 50/1 Lady With The Lamp,  Saratoga Special, 66/1 Vadream
column36: Second in this race in 2022, useful form this season but merely in Listed company
column37: Smart form in 2022 for Paddy Twomey, including second in this race on soft; showed he retained ability when third behind Powerful Nation in a Listed race at Cork in June; two uninspiring runs before second to Grande Marques at Tipperary.

column4: Bar One Racing Flying Five Stakes (Group 1)
column19: Winner of four of his seven races at this venue, ART POWER is tipped in the hope he can hit top form on his second start of the season
column20: 7/2 Asfoora, 5/1 Bucanero Fuerte, 6/1 Arizona Blaze, 8/1 Night Raider, 10/1 Art Power,  Whistlejacket,  Mgheera,  She's Quality, 12/1 Two Stars, 16/1 Nighteyes, 20/1 Powerful Nation, 33/1 Erosandpsyche,  Grande Marques, 50/1 Lady With The Lamp,  Saratoga Special, 66/1 Vadream
column36: 4-4 on AW, an excellent fourth behind Asfoora in the Nunthorpe, might not want it too soft
column37: Made it 4-4 on AW with a Listed win last November; only one win from nine races on turf; however, comes into the reckoning now following an excellent fourth behind Asfoora in the Nunthorpe. was previously on the wrong side at Goodwood, in a race in which She's Quality was second; might not want it too soft.

column4: Bar One Racing Flying Five Stakes (Group 1)
column19: Winner of four of his seven races at this venue, ART POWER is tipped in the hope he can hit top form on his second start of the season
column20: 7/2 Asfoora, 5/1 Bucanero Fuerte, 6/1 Arizona Blaze, 8/1 Night Raider, 10/1 Art Power,  Whistlejacket,  Mgheera,  She's Quality, 12/1 Two Stars, 16/1 Nighteyes, 20/1 Powerful Nation, 33/1 Erosandpsyche,  Grande Marques, 50/1 Lady With The Lamp,  Saratoga Special, 66/1 Vadream
column32: Mrs Anne Gaffney & Tom Gaffney & Liam J Butler
column36: Up an aggregate 19lb for early-season wins here and Naas, suited by soft ground.
column37: Consistent sprint handicapper last year; won off a mark of 91 over C&D on his seasonal debut; raised 11lb for that and took another 8lb rise for beating useful yardstick My Mate Alfie in a Listed race at Naas in April; suited by soft ground.

column4: Bar One Racing Flying Five Stakes (Group 1)
column19: Winner of four of his seven races at this venue, ART POWER is tipped in the hope he can hit top form on his second start of the season
column20: 7/2 Asfoora, 5/1 Bucanero Fuerte, 6/1 Arizona Blaze, 8/1 Night Raider, 10/1 Art Power,  Whistlejacket,  Mgheera,  She's Quality, 12/1 Two Stars, 16/1 Nighteyes, 20/1 Powerful Nation, 33/1 Erosandpsyche,  Grande Marques, 50/1 Lady With The Lamp,  Saratoga Special, 66/1 Vadream
column32: AMO Racing Limited & Giselle De Aguiar
column36: Experienced and generally reliable sort; C&D Group 2 winner before lapse in the Nunthorpe
column37: Very experienced for his age; winner of six of his 16 starts and placed eight times; strong form in winning with something to spare from Mgheera in a C&D Group 2 in July; faded in the final quarter-mile of the Nunthorpe; could bounce back and helps to give the stable a strong hand, with Bucanero Fuerte also in the mix.

column4: Bar One Racing Flying Five Stakes (Group 1)
column19: Winner of four of his seven races at this venue, ART POWER is tipped in the hope he can hit top form on his second start of the season

column36: Consistent before a C&D failure behind Arizona Blaze; failed to rebound at Tipperary
column37: Highly consistent before a Group 2 C&D failure behind Arizona Blaze; failed to rebound from that in a recent Listed race at Tipperary won by Grande Marques

column4: Bar One Racing Flying Five Stakes (Group 1)
column19: Winner of four of his seven races at this venue, ART POWER is tipped in the hope he can hit top form on his second start of the season

column36: Smart last year, troubled run in Commonwealth Cup, started slowly in July Cup, blinkers on
column37: Won the July Stakes and Prix Morny last season; 6f  Listed winner on reappearance; no luck in running on his way to sixth-place finish in the Commonwealth Cup; slowly away and never looked like making an impression in the July Cup; blinkered for the first time.

column4: Bar One Racing Flying Five Stakes (Group 1)
column19: Winner of four of his seven races at this venue, ART POWER is tipped in the hope he can hit top form on his second start of the season
column20: 7/2 Asfoora, 5/1 Bucanero Fuerte, 6/1 Arizona Blaze, 8/1 Night Raider, 10/1 Art Power,  Whistlejacket,  Mgheera,  She's Quality, 12/1 Two Stars, 16/1 Nighteyes, 20/1 Powerful Nation, 33/1 Erosandpsyche,  Grande Marques, 50/1 Lady With The Lamp,  Saratoga Special, 66/1 Vadream
column36: Top-class Australian mare, came good again in the Nunthorpe, set a high standard
column37: Top-class Australian mare, highly durable, winner of 11 of her 27 races; landed the Group 1 King Charles III at Royal Ascot last year; could only dead-heat for fifth in this season's edition and was well below best at Goodwood (She's Quality, second); returned to form with a vengeance when taking the Nunthorpe in emphatic; sets the standard; two wins on soft in 2023.

column4: Bar One Racing Flying Five Stakes (Group 1)
column19: Winner of four of his seven races at this venue, ART POWER is tipped in the hope he can hit top form on his second start of the season
column20: 7/2 Asfoora, 5/1 Bucanero Fuerte, 6/1 Arizona Blaze, 8/1 Night Raider, 10/1 Art Power,  Whistlejacket,  Mgheera,  She's Quality, 12/1 Two Stars, 16/1 Nighteyes, 20/1 Powerful Nation, 33/1 Erosandpsyche,  Grande Marques, 50/1 Lady With The Lamp,  Saratoga Special, 66/1 Vadream
column32: Lord Lloyd Webber And Arthur Mitchell
column36: Slow-starting tendency is a concern, C&D second to Arizona Blaze  before Nunthorpe eighth
column37: Beat today's rival She's Quality to win 5f Group 2 Temple Stakes at Haydock in May; did not compete at Royal Ascot after spreading a plate; outpointed by Arizona Blaze in a C&D Group 2 here in July; was a bit slow out of the stalls, and it was the same story in the Nunthorpe, could feature if avoiding a recurrence.

column4: Bar One Racing Flying Five Stakes (Group 1)
column19: Winner of four of his seven races at this venue, ART POWER is tipped in the hope he can hit top form on his second start of the season
column20: 7/2 Asfoora, 5/1 Bucanero Fuerte, 6/1 Arizona Blaze, 8/1 Night Raider, 10/1 Art Power,  Whistlejacket,  Mgheera,  She's Quality, 12/1 Two Stars, 16/1 Nighteyes, 20/1 Powerful Nation, 33/1 Erosandpsyche,  Grande Marques, 50/1 Lady With The Lamp,  Saratoga Special, 66/1 Vadream
column36: Well held in fifth behind Bucanero Fuerte here last month, has run only once over 5f
column37: Won a 6f Listed race at Naas last season; outran her 100-1 odds with a Group 1 fourth placing over 6f at Royal Ascot; has done most of her arcing over 6f, including when well held in fifth behind Bucanero Fuerte here last month.

column4: Bar One Racing Flying Five Stakes (Group 1)
column19: Winner of four of his seven races at this venue, ART POWER is tipped in the hope he can hit top form on his second start of the season
column20: 7/2 Asfoora, 5/1 Bucanero Fuerte, 6/1 Arizona Blaze, 8/1 Night Raider, 10/1 Art Power,  Whistlejacket,  Mgheera,  She's Quality, 12/1 Two Stars, 16/1 Nighteyes, 20/1 Powerful Nation, 33/1 Erosandpsyche,  Grande Marques, 50/1 Lady With The Lamp,  Saratoga Special, 66/1 Vadream
column36: Mid-field in the Nunthorpe, deserves respect on overall form in British Group 2/3 races
column37: 1-15 in stakes race, that win gained in a 5f Listed event last season; despite that poor strike rate, she deserves plenty of credit for consistency this season; runner-up in four consecutive British Group 2/3 races before well held in mid-field behind Asfoora in the Nunthorpe.

column4: Bar One Racing Flying Five Stakes (Group 1)
column19: Winner of four of his seven races at this venue, ART POWER is tipped in the hope he can hit top form on his second start of the season
column20: 7/2 Asfoora, 5/1 Bucanero Fuerte, 6/1 Arizona Blaze, 8/1 Night Raider, 10/1 Art Power,  Whistlejacket,  Mgheera,  She's Quality, 12/1 Two Stars, 16/1 Nighteyes, 20/1 Powerful Nation, 33/1 Erosandpsyche,  Grande Marques, 50/1 Lady With The Lamp,  Saratoga Special, 66/1 Vadream
column36: Has deteriorated since down the field in this race last year, can be ruled out
column37: On a long losing run, and now to 93 from the 107 mark she held when failing to make an impact in this event last season; in rear in the Temple Stakes won by Mgheera; down the field in the Wokingham and the Coral Golden Handicap.

column4: Bar One Racing Flying Five Stakes (Group 1)
column19: Winner of four of his seven races at this venue, ART POWER is tipped in the hope he can hit top form on his second start of the season

column36: Beat Erosandpsyche in a recent 5f Listed race at Tipperary, this is a different league
column37: Placed in Group 3s at Ayr and Newmarket last season; Listed-placed in third behind Saratoga Special at Ayr in June; made all to beat Erosandpsyche in a 5f Listed race at Tipperary two weeks ago.

column4: Bar One Racing Flying Five Stakes (Group 1)
column19: Winner of four of his seven races at this venue, ART POWER is tipped in the hope he can hit top form on his second start of the season
column20: 7/2 Asfoora, 5/1 Bucanero Fuerte, 6/1 Arizona Blaze, 8/1 Night Raider, 10/1 Art Power,  Whistlejacket,  Mgheera,  She's Quality, 12/1 Two Stars, 16/1 Nighteyes, 20/1 Powerful Nation, 33/1 Erosandpsyche,  Grande Marques, 50/1 Lady With The Lamp,  Saratoga Special, 66/1 Vadream
column32: K Blake/Mrs E Palmer/M Wilson/N Luck
column36: Three-time Listed winner (twice on AW), nothing to suggest she can feature in a Group 1
column37: 5f Dundalk Listed winner last season; has added two more Listed wins to her record this season, at Cork (6f, good) and Chelmsford (6f, AW); struggled in the Commonwealth Cup and not at her best in Group 3/Listed races since.

column4: Bar One Racing Flying Five Stakes (Group 1)
column19: Winner of four of his seven races at this venue, ART POWER is tipped in the hope he can hit top form on his second start of the season
column20: 7/2 Asfoora, 5/1 Bucanero Fuerte, 6/1 Arizona Blaze, 8/1 Night Raider, 10/1 Art Power,  Whistlejacket,  Mgheera,  She's Quality, 12/1 Two Stars, 16/1 Nighteyes, 20/1 Powerful Nation, 33/1 Erosandpsyche,  Grande Marques, 50/1 Lady With The Lamp,  Saratoga Special, 66/1 Vadream
column36: Career-best when landing a 5f Listed race at Ayr in June, faces a huge task at this level
column37: Showed improvement in first-time cheekpieces (retained since) for 50-1 win in Listed race at Ayr (5f, good) in June; down the field in a 5f Group 3 at Sandown; fourth in a 5f handicap at York last time; faces a huge task at this level.

column4: Goffs Vincent O'Brien National Stakes (Group 1) (No Geldings)
column19: Stron claims held by British challengers Saba Desert and Zavateri but GSTAAD could be the one to beat if staying
column20: 5/4 Gstaad, 100/30 Saba Desert, 9/2 Zavateri, 8/1 North Coast, 9/1 Italy, 16/1 Dorset
column36: C&D maiden winner but nearly 3l to find with Zavateri on Goodwood form
column37: 400,000euros yearling by Wootton Bassett; narrowly beaten by a shorter-priced stablemate on C&D debut before landing similar event (beating a subsequent winner); disappointing favourite for Group 2 Vintage Stakes at Goodwood however, plenty keen when nearly 3l off Zavateri; supporting role likely here (tried hooded).

column4: Goffs Vincent O'Brien National Stakes (Group 1) (No Geldings)
column19: Stron claims held by British challengers Saba Desert and Zavateri but GSTAAD could be the one to beat if staying
column20: 5/4 Gstaad, 100/30 Saba Desert, 9/2 Zavateri, 8/1 North Coast, 9/1 Italy, 16/1 Dorset
column32: Derrick Smith & Mrs John Magnier & Michael Tabor
column36: Best form credentials at 6f, the one to beat if staying this trip and handling ground
column37: Starspangledbanner half-brother to classy 2yo sprinter Vandeek; beat a smart filly on Navan debut in May before impressive 3l winner of Group 2 Coventry Stakes at Ascot on quick ground; back from a break for Group 1 Prix Morny (Deauville) last month, getting outpaced at crucial stage before rallying strongly late on when beaten a short-neck; steps up to 7f here on easier ground than he has raced on.

column4: Goffs Vincent O'Brien National Stakes (Group 1) (No Geldings)
column19: Stron claims held by British challengers Saba Desert and Zavateri but GSTAAD could be the one to beat if staying
column20: 5/4 Gstaad, 100/30 Saba Desert, 9/2 Zavateri, 8/1 North Coast, 9/1 Italy, 16/1 Dorset
column36: Solid seconds in Group company since debut win but stiffer task again here
column37: Wootton Bassett colt won on debut in Leopardstown maiden over this trip and creditable second on both starts since, beaten 1.25l by Saba Desert in Group 2 Superlative Stakes (Newmarket) and clear of remainder when 1.5l off Gewan in Group 3 Acomb Stakes at York, quite keen under restraint; easier ground here and has to improve to play a major role.

column4: Goffs Vincent O'Brien National Stakes (Group 1) (No Geldings)
column19: Stron claims held by British challengers Saba Desert and Zavateri but GSTAAD could be the one to beat if staying
column20: 5/4 Gstaad, 100/30 Saba Desert, 9/2 Zavateri, 8/1 North Coast, 9/1 Italy, 16/1 Dorset
column36: Possibly flattered by Tyros win but certainly going the right way and proven over the trip
column37: Starman colt a 180,000gns yearling; ran away with ordinary Down Royal maiden and again when showing considerably better form in 4-runner Group 3 Tyros Stakes at Leopardstown in July, making all to beat an odds-on shot 6l (7f, good-to-yielding); possibly flattered by latest but certainly going the right way and proven over the trip; yard has a good recent record in this race.

column4: Goffs Vincent O'Brien National Stakes (Group 1) (No Geldings)
column19: Stron claims held by British challengers Saba Desert and Zavateri but GSTAAD could be the one to beat if staying
column20: 5/4 Gstaad, 100/30 Saba Desert, 9/2 Zavateri, 8/1 North Coast, 9/1 Italy, 16/1 Dorset
column36: Unbeaten in two, following the same path as yard's 2021 winner Native Trail
column37: Dubawi colt, grandson of Irish 1,000 Guineas winner Gossamer; landed odds on debut in Sandown maiden over this trip in June and followed up in Group 2 Superlative Stakes at Newmarket, avoiding interference on near side then hanging left once hitting the front (beating Italy 1.25l); still a work in progress with likely more to offer and following the same path as yard's 2021 winner Native Trail.

column4: Goffs Vincent O'Brien National Stakes (Group 1) (No Geldings)
column19: Stron claims held by British challengers Saba Desert and Zavateri but GSTAAD could be the one to beat if staying
column20: 5/4 Gstaad, 100/30 Saba Desert, 9/2 Zavateri, 8/1 North Coast, 9/1 Italy, 16/1 Dorset
column36: Dual Group 2 winner; slower ground and stiffer track here but has the right attitude
column37: Without Parole colt cost 35,000gns as a yearling and proving a shrewd buy, unbeaten in three starts; Salisbury novice, held off Coventry second Do Or Do Not in Group 2 July Stakes at Newmarket, and extended margin over same rival when lasting out 7f trip in Group 2 Vintage Stakes at Goodwood, rallying gamely (Dorset a below-par fifth); likely slower ground and stiffer track will place more of an emphasis on stamina but has the right attitude.

column4: Comer Group International Irish St. Leger (Group 1)
column19: Illinois is deserving of success at this level but AL RIFFA could just have that better turn of foot at this distance
column20: 15/8 Illinois, 9/4 Al Riffa, 7/2 Amiloc, 8/1 Al Qareem, 12/1 Crystal Black, 20/1 Leinster, 33/1 Queenstown, 50/1 Dallas Star,  Waldadler
column36: Prolific winner and optimum trip here; place claims
column37: Front-running 6yo who has pulled out more time and time again, with 11 wins now to his credit; three of them were this season at today's trip, twice at Listed level and Group 3 John Smith's Silver Cup at York; unable to dominate at same venue on latest when fourth in Group 2 Lonsdale Stakes over 2m; has fallen short at Group 1 level in the past but deserves his place.

column4: Comer Group International Irish St. Leger (Group 1)
column19: Illinois is deserving of success at this level but AL RIFFA could just have that better turn of foot at this distance
column20: 15/8 Illinois, 9/4 Al Riffa, 7/2 Amiloc, 8/1 Al Qareem, 12/1 Crystal Black, 20/1 Leinster, 33/1 Queenstown, 50/1 Dallas Star,  Waldadler
column27: Sarl De Chambure Haras D'Etreham Et Al
column36: Curragh Cup winner latest; deserved favourite on his way to a likely Melbourne Cup bid
column37: Three-time winner here including 5L success in Group 2 Curragh Cup in July on latest; Group 1 winner as a 2yo and 3yo, acts on easy ground and looks a deserved favourite on his way to a likely Melbourne Cup bid.

column4: Comer Group International Irish St. Leger (Group 1)
column19: Illinois is deserving of success at this level but AL RIFFA could just have that better turn of foot at this distance
column20: 15/8 Illinois, 9/4 Al Riffa, 7/2 Amiloc, 8/1 Al Qareem, 12/1 Crystal Black, 20/1 Leinster, 33/1 Queenstown, 50/1 Dallas Star,  Waldadler
column36: Highly progressive last season, little seen of this term; first attempt at 1m6f
column37: Highly progressive in winning all four starts last year, including twice in Curragh handicaps and Group 3 at Leopardstown (1m4f); very light campaign this year, inadequate trip on return before close second to an all-the-way winner in Group 3 Ballyroan Stakes at Leopardstown last month; first attempt at 1m6f here.

column4: Comer Group International Irish St. Leger (Group 1)

column36: Steadily progressive over further of late; drops in trip here and will appreciate rain
column37: Steadily progressive 4yo won at Leopardstown over 1m1f on soft and career-best when close third to subsequent Group 3 winner Elana Osario in Killarney fillies handicap over 1m4f on similar; another good run here on latest under top-weight when second to an improving 3yo over 1m4f; drops in trip here and will appreciate rain.

column36: Second to Lady In Paris over C&D in July; back from a break with blinkers tried
column37: Maiden win here on the opening day of the season came at 6f (soft), better form upped to today's trip when fourth at Royal Ascot and here in July when outpaced late by 2.25l winner Lady In Paris; back from a break with blinkers tried and 7lb better off with that rival.

column36: Beat Glen To Glen over C&D in July when last seen; 7lb higher but could go well
column37: Thrived with step up in trip this summer, winning at Leopardstown (1m1f) and stayed on strongly over today's C&D in beating Glen To Glen 2.25l in July; 7lb higher but could go well.

column36: Progressive 3yo won't want much more rain now upped in trip
column37: Lightly raced son of Frankel reappeared to win over 1m1f here on Derby weekend and more recently needed every yard when getting up late over a mile at Killarney; not as effective in between on softer ground at Galway so probably won't want much more rain now upped in trip.

column36: Beaten favourite on soft at Galway on penultimate; hard to fancy despite reduced mark
column37: Maiden winner over 1m last summer for William Haggas; just fair form this term in handicaps, beaten favourite on soft at Galway on penultimate; hard to be confident in despite reduced mark.

column32: Don't Let The Old Man In Syndicate
column36: Recent maiden hurdle winner; bit to find unless retained hood brings improvement
column37: Debut winner of heavy-ground maiden here last year (7f) and first success since when taking Galway maiden hurdle six days ago (hooded first time); pick of four previous Flat handicap runs when close fourth over this trip at Sligo; in good heart but looks to have a bit to find unless retained hood brings improvement (1lb wrong).

column36: Thursday's Clonmel fourth a seasonal-best; needs it soft
column37: All three wins have been at 1m2f on soft or heavy, including over C&D; out of form this year until Thursday's staying-on Clonmel fourth on preferred ground which was mildly encouraging; more needed and 2lb wrong.

column36: Last week's Galway third encouraging but this trip is unknown territory and 2lb wrong
column37: Both wins last year came on soft, notably late-season premier handicap here over 1m; last week's Galway third (in first-time cheekpieces, now left off) was his best of the season but this trip is unknown territory and 2lb wrong.

column36: Much improved for new yard, all-the-way wins at Naas and Down Royal; still 7lb wrong here
column37: Has returned from 260-day absence in the form of her life for new yard, making all for today's rider to win over this trip at both Naas and Down Royal (good) in blinkers; up an aggregate of 16lb but remains 7lb out of handicap in this much higher grade.
